name: 4.3: Divergence of a Series - Mathematics LibreTextsmath.libretexts.org › ... › 4: Convergence of Sequences and Series
description: To show divergence we must show that the sequence satisﬁes the negation of the deﬁnition of convergence. That is, we must show that for every r∈R there is an ε>0 such that for every N∈R, there is an n>N with |n−r|≥ε.

description: A sequence is divergent, if it is not convergent. This might be because the sequence tends to infinity or it has more than one limit point.
